data.title: Finding aid to the Fruchtbringende Gesellschaft Collection: Manuscript and Pictorial Material, 1592
data.text:
BANC MSS 98/49: 0049. Letter : Köthen, to an acquaintance within the circle of people surrounding Herzog Bernhards von Weimar (FG30) : ALS, 1634 Oct. 31.

Author(s): Ludwig, Prince of Anhalt-Köthen, 1579-1650 (FG2)

Physical Description: Seal on verso of leaf 2.2 leaves ; 24 x 20 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Letter concerns claims of Prince Ludwig against Herzog Bernhard.

Source/Provenance:

Adam 368, 2

Language:

German

BANC MSS 98/49: 0109. Letter : Vienna, to the "Herrn vndt gutten Freünde" of the Lower Austrian Government in Vienna : ALS, 1640 Oct. 18.

Author(s): Christian Wilhelm, Markgraf von Brandenburg, 1587-1665

Physical Description: 2 page letter. Includes seal on verso of leaf 2.2 leaves ; 32 x 20 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Letter is from the nephew of Christian Markgraf von Brandenburg-Bayreuth, 1581-1655, (FG145).

Language:

German

BANC MSS 98/49: 0333. Bundle of writings regarding the life of Johann Kaspar Buchner: ALS, dates vary from 1656 to 1721.

Author(s): Buchner, Johann Kaspar, 1642-1708

Recipient(s): Buchner, Johann Kaspar, 1642-1708

Physical Description: 8 separate entries:

1. 1 leaf ; 33 x 20 cm.

2. 2 documents: a) 2 leaves ; 28 x 18 cm : b) 2 leaves ; 33 x 19 cm.

3. 1 leaf ; 20 x 33 cm.

5. 2 documents: a) 2 leaves ; 34 x 22 cm : b) 2 leaves ; 33 x 21 cm.

7. 2 leaves ; 22 x 15 cm.

8. 5 leaves ; 32 x 20 cm.

9. 2 leaves ; 34 x 21 cm.

10. 6 documents : 1 leaf ; 11 x 9 cm : 1 leaf ; 14 x 21 cm : 1 leaf ; 16 x 21 cm : 1 leaf ; 21 x 17 cm : 2 leaves ; 33 x 21 cm : 2 leaves ; 33 x 19 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Entries relating to the life of Johann Kaspar Buchner, nephew of Augustus Buchner (1591-1661, FG362).

1. Edict accepting Johann Buchner as a student at the University of Wittenberg.

2. 2 letters for Buchner from Karl Moritz von Redern

3. Attestation from Jobst Christoph Brandt von Lindau for Buchner

5. Johann Heinrich Seufert, Konrektor zu Umstadt, latin poem for Buchner

7. Poem written by Buchner for his wife

8. Personalia written upon Buchner's death in 1708 (good biography).

9. Parsonalia written upon the death of Buchner's wife in 1721.

10. Six miscellaneous documents related to Buchner's life, 17th century.

Entry 4 listed separately ( Box 1, Item 436 )

Entry 6 listed separately ( Box 1, Item 437)

Language:

German, Latin

BANC MSS 98/49: 0493. Letter : Stade, to the Mayor and council of the city of Hildesheim: ALS, 1653 Mar. 23.

Author(s): Königsmarck, Hans Christoff, 1605-1663 (FG515)

Physical Description: 2 page letter. Address and mark of receipt dated 9. Apr. 1653 on verso of leaf 2. Seal missing.2 leaves ; 31 x 20 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Concerning author's takeover of the "Stifte" of Bremen and Verden.

Source/Provenance:

Tenner 116/I, Nr.710, 1977

Language:

German

BANC MSS 98/49: 0605. Letter : Frankfurt a. M., to the Princes of Anhalt (to the senior member of the House, August (FG46), as well as Johann Kasimir (FG10), Christian d. J. (FG51), Rudolf (FG12) and Ludwig (FG2) : ALS, 1634 Sep. 19.

Author(s): Oxenstierna, Axel, Greve, 1583-1654 (FG232)

Recipient(s): August, Fürst von Anhalt-Plötzkau, 1575-1653 (FG46)

Physical Description: Leaf 2 missing.1 leaf ; 33 x 20 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Orders to accept and care for a thousand wounded soldiers belonging to the army of Banér (FG222), which had been beaten three weeks earlier near Nördlingen.

Source/Provenance:

Adam 442

Language:

German

BANC MSS 98/49: 0642. Letter : Derenburg, to the council of the city of Nordhausen : ALS, 1643 Sep. 4.

Author(s): Rochow, Otto Christoph von, 1607-1659 (FG496)

Physical Description: 1 leaf ; 33 x 20 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Author, a Swedish military commander, requests that the city send a contribution of 271Taler for the month of September for the benefit of his two companies.

Source/Provenance:

Wildner 676

Language:

German

BANC MSS 98/49: 0820. Letter : Neu-Augustusburg zu Weissenfels, to the pastor of the Nicolai-Kirche in Weissenfels : ALS, 1687 Jan. 8.

Author(s): Johann Adolf I, Herzog von Sachsen-Weissenfels, 1649-1697 (FG719)

Physical Description: Mark of receipt dated 19. Jan. 1687 on leaf 1. Leaf 2 missing.1 leaf ; 31 x 19 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Concerning a new prayer against the Turks to be read from the pulpit.

Source/Provenance:

Dörling 109, Nov. 1984, Nr.3649

Language:

German

BANC MSS 98/49: 1021b. 11 letters collected by Haubold Heinrich von Starschedel, 1650-1701 (FG848), written between the years of 1638 to 1646. 1638-1646

Author(s): Jentzsch, M. Johann; Merbing, Gabriel; Otto, Johannes

Recipient(s): Starschedel, Heinrich von (maybe written to Bernhard von Starschedel, a well off stewarad and relative of Haubold)

Scope and Content Note

Letters written by three Priests during the 30 Years War, with details about daily life in Saxony, about quarantines and military debts, and a tax table.

11 letters:

Letter : Oschatz, from M. Johann Jentzsch : ALS, 1638 Oct. 3. 1 leaf; 23 x 19 cm.

Letter : Sornzig, from Gabriel Merbing : ALS, 1638 Aug. 28. 2 leaves, address on verson of 2nd leaf; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Oschatz, from M. Johann Jentzsch : ALS, 1639 Feb. 2. 2 leaves, partial seal on 1st leaf, address on verson of 2nd leaf; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Oschatz, from M. Johann Jentzsch : ALS, 1639 Feb. 7. 1 leaf, address on verso; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Molbis, from Johannes Otto : ALS, 1640 Oct. 16. 2 leaves, partial seal and address on verso of 2nd leaf; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Molbis, from Johannes Otto : ALS, 1642 Feb. 17. 2 leaves, partial seal and address on verso of 2nd leaf; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Molbis, from Johannes Otto : ALS, 1643 July 21. 3 leaves, seal and address on verso of 3rd leaf; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Molbis, from Johannes Otto : ALS, 1643 Sept. 29. 2 leaves, partial seal and address on verso of 2nd leaf; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Molbis, from Johannes Otto : ALS, 1643 Nov. 4. (No signature, but same handwritting and in red on front page stating him as the author). 2 leaves; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Molbis, from Johannes Otto : ALS, 1643 Jan. 27. (1641 or 1643, Johannes Otto, on back of letter response(?) dated 8 Dec. 1644 from (C.V. Nassberge?). 2 leaves, seal and address on verso of 2nd leaf; 33 x 20 cm.

Letter : Molbis, from Johannes Otto : ALS, 1646 Jan. 12. 2 leaves, seal and address on verso of 2nd leaf; 33 x 20 cm.

Source/Provenance:

Dresden 1994 (?)

Language:

German

BANC MSS 98/49: 1104. Letter (with supplement) : Osnabrück, to the Princes August (FG46), Ludwig (FG2) and Johann Kasimir of Anhalt (FG10) : ALS, 1648.

Author(s): Wesenbeck, Matthaeus, 1600-1659 (FG433)

Recipient(s): August, Fürst von Anhalt-Plötzkau, 1575-1653 (FG46)

Johann Kasimir, Fürst von Anhalt-Dessau, 1596-1660 (FG10)

Ludwig, Prince of Anhalt-Köthen, 1579-1650 (FG2)

Physical Description: 1. 7 page letter. Address and seal on verso of leaf 4.

2. 4 page (incomplete) letter.2 entries:

1. 4 leaves ; 32 x 21 cm.

2. 2 leaves ; 33 x 21 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Detailed report of the peace negotiations in Osnabrück from the author, a minister of Friedrich Wilhelm, Elector of Brandenburg (FG401).

Source/Provenance:

Stargardt Dec. 1988, Nr.1066

Language:

German

BANC PIC 1998.001:0449. Group portrait of Wilhelm V. Landgraf von Hessen-Kassel, 1602-1637, (FG65) and family. Portrait includes: Amalie Elisabeth, the wife of Wilhelm V, and their six sons, Wilhelm VI. (FG694), Philipp, Wilhelm, Adolf, Karl and Moritz, and their six daughters, Charlotte, Amalie, Agnes, Elisabeth, Elisabeth and Louise.

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 27 x 62 cm.

Source:

Originally from: Der Leichenpredigt auf Landgraf Moritz von Hessen. Monumentum sepulcrale.Mauritii. Kassel and Frankfurt a.M. 1640.

Notes:

Includes 2 panels, each with 4 Latin verses.

Subject:

Amalia Elisabeth, Landgräfin von Hessen-Kassel, 1602-1651

BANC PIC 1998.001:0554. Portrait of Gaspard Corneille de Mortaigne dit de Pottelles, 1608-1647, (FG419).

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 16 x 12 cm.

Subject:

Mortaigne dit de Pottelles, Gaspard Corneille de, 1608-1647

BANC PIC 1998.001:0600. Portrait of Queen Christine of Sweden, 1626-1689. Frederik van Hulsen, sc. and exc.

Creator/Artist: Hulsen, Friedrich van, ca. 1580-ca. 1660Opitz, Martin, 1597-1639 (FG200)

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 22 x 16 cm.

Notes:

Includes 6 Latin verses by Martin Opitz, 1597-1639, (FG200).

Subject:

Kristina, Queen of Sweden, 1626-1689

BANC PIC 1998.001:0875a. Double portrait of Kurfürst Johann Georg I. von Sachsen, 1585-1656, and Herzog August, 1589-1615.

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 19 x 15 cm.

Source:

Originally from a collection of portraits of Saxony's royal families: Markus Henning. Saxoniae Ducum Caesarib. Creand. VII virum. Augsburg, 1601.

Notes:

Father and uncle of Johann Georg II. Kurfürst von Sachsen, 1613-1680, (FG682).

Subject:

August, Herzog von Sachsen, 1589-1615

Johann Georg I, Elector of Saxony, 1585-1656

BANC PIC 1998.001:0916. Portrait of Wilhelm IV. Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662, (FG5) with his six children: Johann Ernst (FG342), Johann Wilhelm, Adolf Wilhelm (FG423), Johann Georg (FG424), Wilhelmine Eleonore and Bernhard (FG427). Peter Troschel, sc.

Creator/Artist: Troschel, Peter

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 28 x 16 cm.

Subject:

Adolf Wilhelm, Herzog von Sachsen-Eisenach, 1632-1668

Bernhard, Herzog von Sachsen-Jena, 1638-1678

Johann Ernst, Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1627-1683

Johann Georg I, Herzog von Sachsen-Eisenach, 1634-1686

Johann Wilhelm, Herzog von Sachsen

Wilhelm IV, Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662

Wilhelmine Eleonore, Herzogin von Sachsen-Weimar, 1636-1653

BANC PIC 1998.001:0958. Portrait of Christian Herzog in Schlesien zu Brieg, Wohlau u. Liegnitz, 1618-1672, (FG505). Johann Frentzel, pos. and exc., Ezechiel Paritius, pinx., Johann Baptist Paravicini, sc.

Creator/Artist: Frentzel, Johann, 1609-1674 Paravicini, Johann Baptist Paritius, Ezechiel

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 31 x 20 cm.

Notes:

Includes dedication by Johann Baptist Paravicini.

Subject:

Christian, Herzog in Schlesien zu Brieg, Wohlau und Liegnitz, 1618-1672

BANC PIC 1998.001:0959. Portrait of Christian Herzog in Schlesien zu Brieg, Wohlau u. Liegnitz, 1618-1672, (FG505). V. Somr. F.(?), I.M.H.(?).

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 17 x 11 cm.

Subject:

Christian, Herzog in Schlesien zu Brieg, Wohlau und Liegnitz, 1618-1672

BANC PIC 1998.001:0964. Portrait of Georg III. Herzog in Schlesien zu Brieg, 1611-1664, (FG520). M. Frentzel, pos. and exc., Ezechiel Paritius, pinx., Johann Baptist Paravicini, sc.

Creator/Artist: Frentzel, M. Paravicini, Johann Baptist Paritius, Ezechiel

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 31 x 19 cm.

Notes:

Includes dedication byJohann Baptist Paravicini.

Subject:

Georg III, Herzog in Schlesien zu Brieg, 1611-1664

BANC PIC 1998.001:1021. Portrait of Ferdinand Maximilian Graf von and zu Sprinzenstein, 1625-1678, (FG668). I. Borcking, sc.

Creator/Artist: Borcking, I.

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 22 x 15 cm.

Subject:

Ferdinand Maximilian, Graf von und zu Sprinzenstein, 1625-1678

BANC PIC 1998.001:1247. "Chur-Sachsen", a map of the lands of the Elector of Saxony. Early 18th century. Handcolored.

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 print : 13 x 16 cm.

BANC PIC 1998.001:1279. Portrait of King Gustav Adolf II. of Sweden, 1594-1632. Portrait was created through the employment of fine calligraphy, most likely the work of Johann Michael Püchler.

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 calligraphic print : 17 x 15 cm.

Subject:

Gustaf II Adolf, King of Sweden, 1594-1632

BANC PIC 1998.001:0068a. View of palace in Kothen belonging to Ludwig Fürst von Anhalt-Köthen, 1579-1650, (FG2). Matthäus Merian, the elder, pinx.

Creator/Artist: Merian, Matthaeus, 1593-1650

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 33 x 24 cm.

Source:

Originally from: Zeiller, M. Topographia Superioris Saxoniae. Frankfurt a.M., 1650.

Subject:

Ludwig, Prince of Anhalt-Köthen, 1579-1650

BANC PIC 1998.001:0085. View of the town of Weissenfeld and how the Imperial military forces under the command of Generalfeldmarschall Piccolomini crossed the Saale River on 9 May 1641. Carlo Cappi, Ingen. del.

Creator/Artist: Cappi, Carlo

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 33 x 21 cm.

Source:

Originally from: Teatri Europaei Virdter Theil. Hrsg. M. Merian. Frankfurt a.M., 1643.

Notes:

Johann Baner, 1596-1641, (FG222) died in Weissenfeld on May 10, 1642.

BANC PIC 1998.001:0135. Portrait of Anton Ulrich Herzog von Braunschweig u. Lüneburg-Wolfenbüttel, 1633-1714, (FG716). Trackert & Co., Braunschweig.

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 print : mezzotint ; 30 x 21 cm.

Subject:

Anton Ulrich, Herzog von Braunschweig-Wolfenbüttel, 1633-1714

BANC PIC 1998.001:0222. Portrait of Georg Wilhelm Herzog von Braunschweig u. Lüneburg-Calenberg, 1624-1705. Anselm van Hulle, pinx., Peter de Jode, sc.

Creator/Artist: Hulle, Anselm van Jode, Peter de

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 35 x 25 cm.

Source:

Originally from: Pacificatores 1697, Nr. 19.

Notes:

Brother of Christian Ludwig Herzog von Braunschweig u. Lüneburg-Celle, 1622-1665, (FG372).

Subject:

Georg Wilhelm, Herzog von Braunschweig und Lüneburg-Calenberg, 1624-1705

BANC PIC 1998.001:0229. View of residence "Beuvern" belonging to Ferdinand Albrecht Herzog von Braunschweig u. Lüneburg-Wolfenbüttel, 1636-1687, (FG842) in Sölling. Matthäus Merian, unsign.

Creator/Artist: Merian, Matthaeus, 1593-1650

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 36 x 15 cm.

Source:

Originally from: Matthäus Merian. Topographia...Der...Stäte, Schlösser...in...Braunschweig und Lünenburg. Frankfurt a.M., 1654. Next to p. 50.

Notes:

x

Subject:

Ferdinand Albrecht I, Duke of Braunschweig-Lüneburg, 1636-1687

BANC PIC 1998.001:0847. Portrait of Johann Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1570-1650, and his family. Peter Troschel, sc.

Creator/Artist: Troschel, Peter

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 25 x 16 cm.

Source:

Originally from: An exemplar of the so-called "Ernestinischen" Bible published after 1641.

Notes:

Father of Johann Ernst d. J. Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1594-1626, (FG3).

Subject:

Johann, Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1570-1605

BANC PIC 1998.001:0855. Portrait of Johann Georg II. Kurfürst von Sachsen, 1613-1680, (FG682). A[nselm] van H[ulle], pinx., Johann Caspar Höckner, sc. and exc.

Creator/Artist: Bohemus, Johann Höckner, Johann Caspar Hulle, Anselm van

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 31 x 22 cm.

Subject:

Johann Georg II, Elector of Saxony, 1613-1680

BANC PIC 1998.001:0878. Portrait of Johann Georg I Kurfürst von Sachsen, 1585-1656. Wolfgang Philipp Kilian, sc. and exc.

Creator/Artist: Kilian, Wolfgang Philipp

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 32 x 25 cm.

Notes:

Father of Johann Georg II. Kurfürst von Sachsen, 1613-1680, (FG682). Includes 4 line dedication in Latin.

Subject:

Johann Georg I, Elector of Saxony, 1585-1656

BANC PIC 1998.001:0879. Portrait of Johann Georg I Kurfürst von Sachsen, 1585-1656. Wolfgang Philipp Kilian, sc. and exc.

Creator/Artist: Kilian, Wolfgang Philipp

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 32 x 25 cm.

Notes:

Father of Johann Georg II. Kurfürst von Sachsen, 1613-1680, (FG682). Includes 4 line dedication in Latin. Portrait is a variant of No. 878.

Subject:

Johann Georg I, Elector of Saxony, 1585-1656

BANC PIC 1998.001:0881. Portrait on horseback of Johann Georg I Kurfürst von Sachsen, 1585-1656.

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 25 x 23 cm.

Notes:

Father of Johann Georg II. Kurfürst von Sachsen, 1613-1680, (FG682).

Subject:

Johann Georg I, Elector of Saxony, 1585-1656

BANC PIC 1998.001:0917. Standing group portrait of Wilhelm IV. Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662, (FG5), together with his six children: Johann Ernst, Johann Wilhelm, Adolf Wilhelm, Johann Georg, Wilhelmine Eleonore and Bernhard. Peter Troschel, sc.

Creator/Artist: Troschel, Peter

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 33 x 21 cm.

Source:

Originally from: An exemplar of the so-called "Ernestinischen" Bible published after 1641.

Notes:

Johann Ernst (FG342), Adolf Wilhelm (FG423), Johann Georg (FG424), and Bernhard (FG427) were also Fruitbearing Society members. On the reverse side there is a biography printed in German of Albrecht III, Herzog zu Sachsen.

Subject:

Adolf Wilhelm, Herzog von Sachsen-Eisenach, 1632-1668

Bernhard, Herzog von Sachsen-Jena, 1638-1678

Johann Ernst, Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1627-1683

Johann Georg I, Herzog von Sachsen-Eisenach, 1634-1686

Johann Wilhelm, son of Wilhelm, Duke of Saxony-Weimar, 1630-1639

Wilhelm IV, Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662

Wilhelmine Eleonore, Herzogin von Sachsen-Weimar, 1636-1653

BANC PIC 1998.001:0919. Three panel print. Panel 1: Portrait of Wilhelm IV. Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662, (FG5). Panel 2: Picture of the palace in Weimar. Panel 3: Picture of the Honorary Gate for Wilhelm IV. Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662, (FG5). F Linck, sc.

Creator/Artist: Linck, F.

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 13 x 24 cm.

Notes:

Print is a 1991 reprint on old paper that utilized the original copperplate. Portrait 1 includes 4 German verses most likely from Georg Neumark (FG605). Panel 3 includes inscription most likely from Georg Neumark (FG605).

Subject:

Wilhelm IV, Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662

BANC PIC 1998.001:0920. Picture of the Honorary Gate for Wilhelm IV. Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662, (FG5). F Linck, fec. and exc.

Creator/Artist: Linck, F.

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 18 x 14 cm.

Notes:

Print is a 1991 reprint on old paper that utilized the original copperplate. Includes 4 Latin verses inscribed upon the Honorary Gate from Georg Neumark (FG605) as well as 4 accompanying German verses.

Subject:

Wilhelm IV, Herzog von Sachsen-Weimar, 1598-1662

BANC PIC 1998.001:0963. Portrait of Louise Herzogin in Schlesien zu Brieg, Wohlau und Liegnitz, 1632-1680. Johann Frentzel, pos. and exc., Ezechiel Paritius, pinx., Johann Baptist Paravicini, sc.

Creator/Artist: Paravicini, Johann Baptist Paritius, Ezechiel

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 30 x 22 cm.

Notes:

Wife of Christian Herzog in Schlesien zu Brieg, Wohlau und Liegnitz, 1618-1672, (FG505).

Subject:

Louise, Herzogin in Schlesien zu Brieg, Wohlau u. Liegnitz, 1632-1680

BANC PIC 1998.001:0098. Depiction of the "Schwedischen Friedensmahls (trans. Swedish Peace Banquet), in Nürnberg de 25. Herbstm. Anno 1649.".

Creator/Artist: Unknown

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 30 x 40 cm.

Notes:

The Banquet was described by Sigmund von Birken (FG681), see catalogue entry no. 97, and attended by several Fruitbearing society members, including Gebhard von Alvensleben (FG479), Georg Achaz Heher (FG590), Landgraf Friedrich von Hessen (FG566), Fürst Georg Ludwig von Nassau (FG319), Octavio Piccolomini Duca d' Amalfi (FG356), Wolf Konrad von

Subject:

Birken, Sigmund von, 1626-1681 (FG681)

BANC PIC 1998.001:0532. Portrait of Adolf von May, ?-1663, (FG541). Anselm van Hulle, pinx., Peter de Jode, sc.

Creator/Artist: Hulle, Anselm van Jode, Peter de

Physical Description: 1 print : copperplate ; 31 x 20 cm.

Source:

Originally from: Pacificatores 1697, Nr. 94.

Subject:

May, Adolf von, ?-1663

BANC PIC 1998.001:0968. Map of the lands of Georg Rudolf Herzog in Schlesien zu Liegnitz u. Wohlau, 1595-1653, (FG58).

Creator/Artist: Scultetus, Jonas, 1603-1664

Physical Description: 1 print : colored copperplate ; 40 x 49 cm.

Source:

Originally from: Johannes Janssonius. Novi Atlantis, Anhang oder Neuer Welt-beschreibung. Dritter Theil. Amsterdam, 1642.

Notes:

Includes dedication by Geographer Scultetus aus Sprotta, 1603-1664.

Subject:

Georg Rudolf, Herzog in Schlesien zu Liegnitz u. Wohlau, 1595-1653
